commit_message:
Adding missing localtime mounts and volumes

PS adds missing localtime mount to mariadb,rabbitmq,keystone and
memcached. Also it standardize on host-etc-localtime as volume name
and fixes bunch of other inconsistency encountered with logging
enabled.

Partially-Implemets: blueprint centralized-logging

Change-Id: I849d5a3051d630c236e6babb21c846aef8646350

commit_message:
Fix CentOS Ansible bootstrap

This patch implements the following fixes to the bootstrap-ansible
script in order to make it work successfully on CentOS7:

 - Remove yum check-update as it returns 0 only when no updates are
   available.
 - Add a variable to adjust the virtualenv CLI based on the distro
   used as '--always-copy' does not work on CentOS.


Change-Id: Ia591c3558bd00945dc3076ed19d4c6e364bec939

commit_message:
Make subprocess outputs to text for Python 3

This commit makes subprocess outputs to str with universal_newlines
option. In Python 3, we need to do it explicitly. Otherwise an error
occurs. This commit also adds a unit test to prevent regression.

Change-Id: I2e428a3c57357e47c9057e8dbbbb51ae4b65e4e6

commit_message:
Add 'More Actions...' Actions

This patch adds actions named 'More Actions...' that for each resource type
redirects to the resource's legacy details page.  This is achieved through
a redirect action service that is added just like any other action to the
resource's item action list.

Adds:
* Instances
* Volumes
* Volume Snapshots
* Networks
* Subnets
* Ports
* Routers
* Hypervisors

Change-Id: I6e6bb3ac6511cef7b8397db4a6517dd209992616
Partially-Implements: blueprint sl-ui-use-hz-registry

subject: Determine disk_format for volume-backed snapshot from schema
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-24 15:27:29.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/b8ac1966c21772e219711056978d6b22685cda73', 'message': "WIP: Determine disk_format for volume-backed snapshot from schema

Xen deployments don't support qcow2 images which is what the
glance v2 API code in nova defaults to, so basically you can't
create a snapshot of a volume-backed instance with glance v2 and
Xen right now.

This change uses the glance v2 image schema to determine the
disk_format to use based on some rules:

1. If there is only one disk_format supported, use it.
2. Look for a preferred disk_format using an ordered list.
3. If we still can't figure it out, just use the first
   supported disk_format available.

We do something similar for container_format as well.

Change-Id: Ifaa150fda393e2b49114e30dd5e30e5bf52b4ed1
Closes-Bug: #1616938

commit_message:
Determine disk_format for volume-backed snapshot from schema

Xen deployments don't support qcow2 images which is what the
glance v2 API code in nova defaults to, so basically you can't
create a snapshot of a volume-backed instance with glance v2 and
Xen right now.

This change uses the glance v2 image schema to determine the
disk_format to use based on some rules:

1. Look for a preferred disk_format using an ordered list.
2. If we still can't figure it out, just use the first
   supported disk_format available.

Change-Id: Ifaa150fda393e2b49114e30dd5e30e5bf52b4ed1
Closes-Bug: #1616938
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/75/375875/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _get_image_create_disk_format_default(self): """Gets an acceptable default image disk_format based on the schema. """ # get the image schema image_schema = self._client.schemas.get('image') # These preferred disk formats are in order: # 1. we want qcow2 if possible (at least for backward compat) # 2. raw should be universally accepted # 3. vhd/vmdk are preferred for xenapi/vmware, respectively preferred_disk_formats = ('qcow2', 'raw', 'vhd', 'vmdk') # get the disk_format schema property from the raw schema # FIXME(mriedem): glanceclient's SchemaProperty object does not store # the valid enums so we can't use image_schema.properties, we need to # fix that so we're not using the internal _raw_schema attribute. disk_format_schema = ( image_schema._raw_schema['properties'].get('disk_format') ) if disk_format_schema: supported_disk_formats = disk_format_schema['enum'] # if there is only one option, use that if len(supported_disk_formats) == 1: disk_format = supported_disk_formats[0] LOG.debug('The Image Service v2 API only supports a single ' 'disk_format for images: %s', disk_format) return disk_format # try a priority ordered list for preferred_format in preferred_disk_formats: if preferred_format in supported_disk_formats: return preferred_format # alright, let's just return whatever is available LOG.debug('Unable to find a preferred disk_format for image ' 'creation with the Image Service v2 API. Using: %s', supported_disk_formats[0]) return supported_disk_formats[0] else: LOG.warning(_LW('Unable to determine disk_format schema from the ' 'Image Service v2 API. Defaulting to ' '%(preferred_disk_format)s.'), {'preferred_disk_format': preferred_disk_formats[0]}) sent_service_image_meta['disk_format'] = ( self._get_image_create_disk_format_default() ) if 'container_format' not in sent_service_image_meta: # TODO(mriedem): get the default to use based on image schema

commit_message:
RBAC for network sharing

Adds support for the new Newton Neutron RBAC
policy functionality. This allows networks to be
shared across tenants.

For more information, please take a look at:
https://developer.rackspace.com/blog/A-First-Look-at-RBAC-in-the-Liberty-Release-of-Neutron/

Change-Id: Ie433dbd2554648bad7ca9f6940069c85258b03c7
Implements: blueprint neutron-tenant-rbac
(cherry picked from commit aef7fed1409702cf057ee05273f7fe801e5ef4e7)

added_lines: def get_docs_by_nested_field(self, path, field, value, version=False): """Query ElasticSearch based on a nested field. The caller will need to specify the path of the nested field as well as the field itself. We will include the 'version' field if commanded as such by the caller. """ # Set up query for accessing a nested field. nested_field = path + "." + field body = {"query": {"nested": { "path": path, "query": {"term": {nested_field: value}}}}} if version: body['version'] = True try: return self.engine.search(index=self.alias_name, doc_type=self.document_type, body=body, ignore_unavailable=True) except Exception as exc: LOG.warning(_LW( 'Error querying %(p)s %(f)s. Error %(exc)s') % {'p': path, 'f': field, 'exc': exc}) raise

commit_message:
Return __searchlight-user-role with highlighting

When highlighting is enabled, it is possible to
return the '__searchlight-user-role' field. We
need to stop doing that.

Change-Id: I4992e5e3fefb388e66f07ee021402019eebac1a5
Closes-Bug: #1599332

Swiftclient is logging a 404 when looking for
overcloud-without-mergepy.yaml.  To stop this, disable logging
below the critical level for swiftclient.  Note that we catch the
resulting exception from swiftclient and log it ourselves if
necessary, so there's no loss of information in the legitimate

commit_message:
Stop logging swiftclient errors

Swiftclient is logging a 404 when looking for
overcloud-without-mergepy.yaml.  To stop this, disable logging
below the critical level for swiftclient.  Note that we catch the
resulting exception from swiftclient and log it ourselves if
necessary, so there's no loss of information in the legitimate
error case.

Change-Id: I24144f3ab2b63c4a0f5fc2c9271e4a51a9ea1353
Closes-Bug: 1626267
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-tripleoclient refs/changes/86/374386/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Swiftclient logs things like 404s at error level, which is a problem # because we use EAFP to check for the existence of files. Turn off # most swiftclient logging to avoid cluttering up our output with # pointless tracebacks. sc_logger = logging.getLogger("swiftclient") sc_logger.setLevel(logging.CRITICAL)

subject: Back vNICs with only link-up phys ports
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-16 18:32:20.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova-powervm/commit/389773607164a2d28332c382fea1b8614320fd25', 'message': "Back vNICs with only link-up phys ports by default

Previously, a vNIC's backing devices were chosen purely based on their
saturation (available capacity and number of logical ports), regardless
of link status.  With this change set, the default behavior is NOT to
use physical ports whose link status is 'down'.  This can be changed via
a new config option, [powervm].vnic_check_port_status.  When the default
(True) is overridden (False), the previous behavior is enacted.

Change-Id: I2c9e201243c1134319cc80622e6e9ed7377721ae

Previously, a vNIC's backing devices were chosen purely based on their
saturation (available capacity and number of logical ports), regardless

physical ports whose link status is 'down'.

Change-Id: I2c9e201243c1134319cc80622e6e9ed7377721ae
"}]
commit_message:
Back vNICs with only link-up phys ports

Previously, a vNIC's backing devices were chosen purely based on their
saturation (available capacity and number of logical ports), regardless
of link status.  With this change set, the behavior is NOT to use
physical ports whose link status is 'down'.

Change-Id: I2c9e201243c1134319cc80622e6e9ed7377721ae
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-powervm refs/changes/57/371757/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: vnic_opts = [ cfg.BoolOpt('vnic_check_port_status', default=True, help='If False, SR-IOV physical ports with "down" link status ' 'may be used as vNIC backing devices.') ] + npiv_opts + remote_restart_opts + swift_opts + vnc_opts + vnic_opts)

Tenacity provides the same functionality as retrying, but has the

need to account for this via mocking of time.sleep before
tenacity is imported.

function raises, whereas retrying retried on all exceptions.

This patch updates all usages of retrying with tenacity.
Unit tests will be added where applicable.

Note: This change is not newton critical so projects are welcome
to hold off on committing until post-newton. Ideally this change
will merge by the first part of Ocata so dependant functionality
can land and have time to solidify for Ocata.

[1] https://github.com/jd/tenacity

Change-Id: I18f9a0ab3f73655139c60ee3d059f4859549160f

commit_message:
Replace retrying with tenacity

We are replacing all usages of the 'retrying' package with
'tenacity' as the author of retrying is not actively maintaining
the project. Tenacity is a fork of retrying, but has improved the
interface and extensibility (see [1] for more details). Our end
goal here is removing the retrying package from our requirements.

Tenacity provides the same functionality as retrying, but has the
following major differences to account for:
- Tenacity uses seconds rather than ms as retrying did.
- Tenacity has different kwargs for the decorator and
Retrying class itself.
- Tenacity has a different approach for retrying args by
using classes for its stop/wait/retry kwargs.
- By default tenacity raises a RetryError if a retried callable
times out; retrying raises the last exception from the callable.
Tenacity provides backwards compatibility here by offering
the 'reraise' kwarg.
- Tenacity defines 'time.sleep' as a default value for a kwarg.
That said consumers who need to mock patch time.sleep
need to account for this via mocking of time.sleep before
tenacity is imported.
- For retries that check a result, tenacity will raise if the retried
function raises, whereas retrying retried on all exceptions.

This patch updates all usages of retrying with tenacity.
Unit tests will be added where applicable.

Note: This change is not newton critical so projects are welcome
to hold off on committing until post-newton. Ideally this change
will merge by the first part of Ocata so dependant functionality
can land and have time to solidify for Ocata.

[1] https://github.com/jd/tenacity

Change-Id: I18f9a0ab3f73655139c60ee3d059f4859549160f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-ovn refs/changes/97/367997/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Do not display Visibility column when All Projects option shown

This patch toggles the visbility column display based on the all-projects
selection, the reason being that the context for the logic used in
determining visibility is changed confusingly, as described in the ticket.

Change-Id: I5140f4f54253d2d274253384434ebdaa43c52e7f
Closes-Bug: 1618210

commit_message:
log info was written to pid file

update the freezer-scheduler config file as follow:
log_file = scheduler.log
log_dir = /home/log

After freezer-scheduler start, the log info was written to pid file.

All open file descriptors were closed while daemonizing. And the pid
file was created and open, The pid file is using the same fileno
as log file. The logger doesn't know its file has already been
closed. So the log info will be written to pid file.

Pass the logging handler through to the daemon using the
DaemonContext's files_preserve option.

Change-Id: I8a0b2da5c2be41a3ae8cedfec44a682ccba353d8
Partial-Bug: #1610904
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/freezer refs/changes/84/375284/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def get_filenos(logger): """ Get a list of file no from logger """ filenos = [] for handler in logger.handlers: filenos.append(handler.stream.fileno()) if logger.parent: filenos += get_filenos(logger.parent) return filenos files_preserve = get_filenos(LOG.logger) with DaemonContext(pidfile=pidfile, signal_map=self.signal_map, files_preserve=files_preserve):

commit_message:
Use assertIn instead of assertTrue(A in B)

Developers should use assertIn(A, B) instead of assertTrue(A in B ).

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I31e20fae988b71145ec7b82fa696a87c4dbcc4e3

commit_message:
Make neutron-fwaas functional job not experimental

With the advent of additional functional tests, the functional test job
for neutron-fwaas should be moved from the check-experimental queue to
the check queue.  The job is also changed to be voting.

Depends-On: I5c7eab23f3a069721887e6365d563dd9b64805d5

Change-Id: Idef9074f770f545f9e37e3477e56932aeb58748f

commit_message:
Add Grafana dashboard for FWaaS checks

The neutron-fwaas project currently does not have any kind of Grafana
dashboard showing error rates over time, so let's fix that.

Depends-On: I5c7eab23f3a069721887e6365d563dd9b64805d5
Change-Id: I26263e1de50e9a3f5b963766a5a1f4aa54ef4c89

commit_message:
Integrate neutron-fwaas with neutron-lib CI

This patch adds the periodic-jobs-with-neutron-lib-master test to
neutron-fwaas.  This will validate that neutron-lib master is working
with the master of neutron-fwaas.

Change-Id: I5c7eab23f3a069721887e6365d563dd9b64805d5

Minor edits to description Web app reference arch

Just minor wording changes to the description field for the 3-tier
web application WordPress/LAMP entry
Fixed tabs

Change-Id: I2bb03e906bced036bce55dfbea5e84104acaefd6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/app-catalog refs/changes/33/377833/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: This is the sample heat template for the Web Application reference architecture document produced by the OpenStack Enterprise Working Group. The reference architecture document can be found at https://www.openstack.org/enterprise. This heat template deploys WordPress on a 3-Tier LAMP architecture. There are two versions of the template - one creates a static environment which does not require ceilometer; the other provides autoscaling of the web and application tiers based on CPU load which requires ceilometer. For more details please refer to the README file in the zip file on how to use the template. The templates have been tested on Mitaka release of OpenStack, and Ubuntu Server 14.04 and Centos7.
deleted_lines: This is the sample demonstration heat templates for a 3-tier web application produced by OpenStack Enterprise Working Group. The document of the reference architecture can be found at https://www.openstack.org/enterprise. This deploys WordPress on a 3-Tier LAMP architecture. There are two versions of the template - one creates a static environment which does not require ceilometer; the other provides autoscaling of the web and application tiers based on CPU load which requires ceilometer. For more details please refer to the README file in the zip file on how to use the template. The templates are tested on Mitaka release of OpenStack, and Ubuntu Server 14.04 and Centos7.

commit_message:
Process OVS trunk bridges associated to VM deletes

If a VM is deleted while the OVS agent is down, upon
restart the OVS trunk bridge is deleted successfully
but the patch ports integration bridge side are left
behind.

This patch makes sure the bridge as well as its peers
are cleaned up.

Closes-bug: #1623708

Change-Id: I3f010755fdb6501753d20357ad2cd0d6c02cf22a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/32/375132/9 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Determine the state of the trunk bridge by looking for the VM's port, # i.e. the trunk parent port to be present. If the VM is absent, i.e. # this fails with a timeout, then we clean the dangling bridge. # If the VM is present, the value of rewire tells us whether or not the # bridge was dealt whith in a prior added event. rewire = self._check_trunk_bridge_state(bridge) if rewire is None: LOG.debug("No instance associated to bridge could be found") self.trunk_manager.dispose_trunk(bridge) def _check_trunk_bridge_state(self, bridge): """Look for instance or service ports on the bridge. :return: True if the trunk needs rewiring, False otherwise. If None is returned, no state could be determined. """ bridge_has_port_predicate = functools.partial( bridge_has_instance_port, bridge) try: common_utils.wait_until_true( bridge_has_port_predicate, timeout=WAIT_FOR_PORT_TIMEOUT) except eventlet.TimeoutError: LOG.error( _LE('No port present on trunk bridge %(br_name)s ' 'in %(timeout)d seconds. Cleaning up the bridge'), {'br_name': bridge.br_name, 'timeout': WAIT_FOR_PORT_TIMEOUT}) return return bridge_has_service_port(bridge)
deleted_lines: # Wait for the VM's port, i.e. the trunk parent port, to show up. # If the VM fails to show up, i.e. this fails with a timeout, # then we clean the dangling bridge. bridge_has_port_predicate = functools.partial( bridge_has_instance_port, bridge) try: common_utils.wait_until_true( bridge_has_port_predicate, timeout=WAIT_FOR_PORT_TIMEOUT) except eventlet.TimeoutError: LOG.error( _LE('No port appeared on trunk bridge %(br_name)s ' 'in %(timeout)d seconds. Cleaning up the bridge'), {'br_name': bridge.br_name, 'timeout': WAIT_FOR_PORT_TIMEOUT}) bridge.destroy() rewire = bridge_has_service_port(bridge)

subject: Add functional regression test for bug 1595962
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-06 17:31:59.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/ebc7dca7210b2c02d555e6b018fe022de87ee7aa', 'message': 'Add functional regression test for bug 1595962

If the graphical consoles VNC and SPICE are disabled, the live-migration
of an instance will result in an ERROR state. VNC and SPICE are usually
disabled on IBM z systems platforms where graphical consoles are not
available. The serial console is then enabled and VNC + SPICE are
disabled. The logged error message will be:

    "Migration error: Your libvirt version does not support the
    VIR_DOMAIN_XML_MIGRATABLE flag or your destination node does
    not support retrieving listen addresses. In order for live
    migration to work properly you must either disable serial
    console or upgrade your libvirt version."

This functional test executes the live migration flow with enabled serial
console and disabled VNC + SPICE and reproduces bug 1595962.

Change-Id: Ib1b22ce77d8a36e55944acc1fbca042906aa41ef
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-07-07 12:14:44.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/cd8b8bf5fe16d19004cf15941bd87ca69b59c69d', 'message': 'Add functional regression test for bug 1595962

of an instance will result in an ERROR state. VNC and SPICE are usually
disabled on IBM z systems platforms where graphical consoles are not

disabled. The logged error message will be:

    VIR_DOMAIN_XML_MIGRATABLE flag or your destination node does
    not support retrieving listen addresses. In order for live
    migration to work properly you must either disable serial
    console or upgrade your libvirt version."

This functional test executes the live migration flow with enabled serial
console and disabled VNC + SPICE and reproduces bug 1595962.

Related-Bug: 1595962

Change-Id: Ib1b22ce77d8a36e55944acc1fbca042906aa41ef

    migration to work properly you must either disable serial
    console or upgrade your libvirt version."

console and disabled VNC + SPICE and reproduces bug 1595962.

commit_message:
Add functional regression test for bug 1595962

If the graphical consoles VNC and SPICE are disabled, the live-migration
of an instance will result in an ERROR state. VNC and SPICE are usually
disabled on IBM z systems platforms where graphical consoles are not
available. The serial console is then enabled and VNC + SPICE are
disabled. The logged error message will be:

    "Migration error: Your libvirt version does not support the
    VIR_DOMAIN_XML_MIGRATABLE flag or your destination node does
    not support retrieving listen addresses. In order for live
    migration to work properly you must either disable serial
    console or upgrade your libvirt version."

This functional test executes the live migration flow with enabled serial
console and disabled VNC + SPICE and reproduces bug 1595962.

Related-Bug: 1595962

Change-Id: Ib1b22ce77d8a36e55944acc1fbca042906aa41ef

added_lines: # Copyright 2016 IBM Corp. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import fixtures import mock import time import nova.conf from nova import test from nova.tests import fixtures as nova_fixtures from nova.tests.unit import cast_as_call from nova.tests.unit import policy_fixture from nova.tests.unit.virt.libvirt import fake_libvirt_utils from nova.tests.unit.virt.libvirt import fakelibvirt CONF = nova.conf.CONF class TestSerialConsoleLiveMigrate(test.TestCase): REQUIRES_LOCKING = True def setUp(self): super(TestSerialConsoleLiveMigrate, self).setUp() self.useFixture(policy_fixture.RealPolicyFixture()) api_fixture = self.useFixture(nova_fixtures.OSAPIFixture( api_version='v2.1')) # Replace libvirt with fakelibvirt self.useFixture(fixtures.MonkeyPatch( 'nova.virt.libvirt.driver.libvirt_utils', fake_libvirt_utils)) self.useFixture(fixtures.MonkeyPatch( 'nova.virt.libvirt.driver.libvirt', fakelibvirt)) self.useFixture(fixtures.MonkeyPatch( 'nova.virt.libvirt.host.libvirt', fakelibvirt)) self.useFixture(fixtures.MonkeyPatch( 'nova.virt.libvirt.guest.libvirt', fakelibvirt)) self.useFixture(fakelibvirt.FakeLibvirtFixture()) self.admin_api = api_fixture.admin_api self.api = api_fixture.api # the image fake backend needed for image discovery nova.tests.unit.image.fake.stub_out_image_service(self) nova.tests.unit.fake_network.set_stub_network_methods(self) self.flags(compute_driver='libvirt.LibvirtDriver') self.flags(enabled=True, group="serial_console") self.flags(enabled=False, group="vnc") self.flags(enabled=False, group="spice") self.flags(use_usb_tablet=False, group="libvirt") self.flags(host="test_compute1") self.start_service('conductor', manager=CONF.conductor.manager) self.flags(scheduler_driver='chance_scheduler') self.start_service('scheduler') self.network = self.start_service('network') self.compute = self.start_service('compute', host='test_compute1') self.consoleauth = self.start_service('consoleauth') self.useFixture(cast_as_call.CastAsCall(self.stubs)) self.addCleanup(nova.tests.unit.image.fake.FakeImageService_reset) self.image_id = self.api.get_images()[0]['id'] self.flavor_id = self.api.get_flavors()[0]['id'] @mock.patch('nova.conductor.tasks.live_migrate.LiveMigrationTask.' '_check_destination_is_not_source', return_value=False) @mock.patch('nova.virt.libvirt.LibvirtDriver._create_image') def test_serial_console_live_migrate(self, mock_create_image, mock_conductor_source_check): """Regression test for bug #1595962. If the graphical consoles VNC and SPICE are disabled, the live-migration of an instance will result in an ERROR state. VNC and SPICE are usually disabled on IBM z systems platforms where graphical consoles are not available. The serial console is then enabled and VNC + SPICE are disabled. The error will be raised at https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/ 4f33047d07f5a11b208c344fe206aba01cd8e6fe/ nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py#L5842-L5852 """ fake_connection = fakelibvirt.Connection('qemu:///system', version=1002007, hv_version=2001000) with mock.patch('nova.virt.libvirt.host.Host.get_connection', return_value=fake_connection): server_attr = dict(name='server1', imageRef=self.image_id, flavorRef=self.flavor_id) server = self.api.post_server({'server': server_attr}) server = self.api.get_server(server['id']) timeout = 0.0 while server['status'] != "ACTIVE" and timeout < 10.0: time.sleep(.1) timeout += .1 server = self.api.get_server(server['id']) if server['status'] != "ACTIVE": self.fail("server build did time out.") post = {"os-migrateLive": { "block_migration": False, "disk_over_commit": False, "host": "test_compute1" }} try: # This should succeed self.admin_api.post_server_action(server['id'], post) except Exception as ex: self.fail(ex.response.content)

commit_message:
Update CONTRIBUTING.rst

Potential contributors are still not getting the message about our
disallowed minor code changes, so adding a paragraph to CONTRIBUTING.rst
to mention this up front.

Change-Id: I837590bbb83cfba83433c7c4625a2ca5870fa179

subject: Determine disk_format for volume-backed snapshot from schema
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-26 18:12:45.000000000', 'files': ['nova/image/glance.py', 'nova/tests/unit/image/test_glance.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/7c4a5b1ee729a4e9bb6add2a6b6423f9bbd1c0d0', 'message': "Determine disk_format for volume-backed snapshot from schema

Xen deployments don't support qcow2 images which is what the
glance v2 API code in nova defaults to, so basically you can't
create a snapshot of a volume-backed instance with glance v2 and
Xen right now.

This change uses the glance v2 image schema to determine the
disk_format to use based on some rules:

1. Look for a preferred disk_format using an ordered list.
2. If we still can't figure it out, just use the first
   supported disk_format available.

Change-Id: Ifaa150fda393e2b49114e30dd5e30e5bf52b4ed1
Closes-Bug: #1616938
(cherry picked from commit 2fe5daeb5fcd2750b0eb083fc5c8bfd3fdb992e2)

commit_message:
Determine disk_format for volume-backed snapshot from schema

Xen deployments don't support qcow2 images which is what the
glance v2 API code in nova defaults to, so basically you can't
create a snapshot of a volume-backed instance with glance v2 and
Xen right now.

This change uses the glance v2 image schema to determine the
disk_format to use based on some rules:

1. Look for a preferred disk_format using an ordered list.
2. If we still can't figure it out, just use the first
   supported disk_format available.

Change-Id: Ifaa150fda393e2b49114e30dd5e30e5bf52b4ed1
Closes-Bug: #1616938
(cherry picked from commit 2fe5daeb5fcd2750b0eb083fc5c8bfd3fdb992e2)

added_lines: import copy def raw(self): return copy.deepcopy(self.raw_schema) def test_create_success_v2_force_activate( self, trans_to_mock, trans_from_mock): """Tests that creating an image with the v2 API with a size of 0 will trigger a call to set the disk and container formats. """ self.flags(use_glance_v1=False, group='glance') translated = { 'name': mock.sentinel.name, } trans_to_mock.return_value = translated trans_from_mock.return_value = mock.sentinel.trans_from # size=0 will trigger force_activate=True image_mock = {'size': 0} client = mock.MagicMock() client.call.return_value = {'id': '123'} ctx = mock.sentinel.ctx service = glance.GlanceImageServiceV2(client) with mock.patch.object(service, '_get_image_create_disk_format_default', return_value='vdi'): image_meta = service.create(ctx, image_mock) trans_to_mock.assert_called_once_with(image_mock) # Verify that the disk_format and container_format kwargs are passed. create_call_kwargs = client.call.call_args_list[0][1] self.assertEqual('vdi', create_call_kwargs['disk_format']) self.assertEqual('bare', create_call_kwargs['container_format']) trans_from_mock.assert_called_once_with({'id': '123'}) self.assertEqual(mock.sentinel.trans_from, image_meta) @mock.patch('nova.image.glance._translate_from_glance') @mock.patch('nova.image.glance._translate_to_glance') def _test_get_image_create_disk_format_default(self, test_schema, expected_disk_format): mock_client = mock.MagicMock() mock_client.call.return_value = test_schema service = glance.GlanceImageServiceV2(mock_client) disk_format = service._get_image_create_disk_format_default( mock.sentinel.ctx) self.assertEqual(expected_disk_format, disk_format) mock_client.call.assert_called_once_with( mock.sentinel.ctx, 2, 'get', 'image', controller='schemas') def test_get_image_create_disk_format_default_no_schema(self): """Tests that if there is no disk_format schema we default to qcow2. """ test_schema = FakeSchema({'properties': {}}) self._test_get_image_create_disk_format_default(test_schema, 'qcow2') def test_get_image_create_disk_format_default_single_entry(self): """Tests that if there is only a single supported disk_format then we use that. """ test_schema = FakeSchema({ 'properties': { 'disk_format': { 'enum': ['iso'], } } }) self._test_get_image_create_disk_format_default(test_schema, 'iso') def test_get_image_create_disk_format_default_multiple_entries(self): """Tests that if there are multiple supported disk_formats we look for one in a preferred order. """ test_schema = FakeSchema({ 'properties': { 'disk_format': { # For this test we want to skip qcow2 since that's primary. 'enum': ['vhd', 'raw'], } } }) self._test_get_image_create_disk_format_default(test_schema, 'vhd') def test_get_image_create_disk_format_default_multiple_entries_no_match( self): """Tests that if we can't match a supported disk_format to what we prefer then we take the first supported disk_format in the list. """ test_schema = FakeSchema({ 'properties': { 'disk_format': { # For this test we want to skip qcow2 since that's primary. 'enum': ['aki', 'ari', 'ami'], } } }) self._test_get_image_create_disk_format_default(test_schema, 'aki')

commit_message:
Add note about puppet-ceph

puppet-ceph should be released separately from the rest of the puppet
modules since the branching is handled differently.

Change-Id: I8f12253b7f9cbcc90284b7af6dd4046c79370a0b

commit_message:
VCS fix

  * Using OpenStack's Gerrit as VCS URLs.
  * Point .gitreview to OpenStack's Gerrit packaging-deb.
  * Add .gitreview to extend-diff-ignore.
  * Add debian/source.lintian-overrides.

Change-Id: I09b3a85652b2a6a8afa70d858825ec697b40868c

commit_message:
Revert "Add auth functional tests"

This reverts commit 2a91a41142080a4f1abb8f9846f88846c6b5c6b7.

This is a quick fix to unblock the python-keystoneclient gate. Not
closing the bug since we can fix the test behavior by using an extra
client just to run the tests operations.

Change-Id: I976488243ad3c357cd2aeb604973603380858dc4
Related-Bug: 1626131
(cherry picked from commit ca669701f7ca8ef17d32ab7b56430cef1ce23431)

See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from keystoneclient.tests.functional import base from keystoneclient.tests.functional.v3 import client_fixtures as fixtures class AuthTestCase(base.V3ClientTestCase): def test_projects(self): project = fixtures.Project(self.client, self.project_domain_id) self.useFixture(project) role = fixtures.Role(self.client) self.useFixture(role) self.client.roles.grant(role.id, user=self.user_id, project=project.id) projects = self.client.auth.projects() self.assertIn(project.entity, projects) def test_domains(self): domain = fixtures.Domain(self.client) self.useFixture(domain) role = fixtures.Role(self.client) self.useFixture(role) self.client.roles.grant(role.id, user=self.user_id, domain=domain.id) domains = self.client.auth.domains() self.assertIn(domain.entity, domains)

commit_message:
Fix NTP servers hieradata

This patch enables correctly setting the NTP server passed via
--ntp-server in the overcloud nodes' /etc/ntp.conf.

Change-Id: Iff644b9da51fb8cd1946ad9d297ba0e94d3d782b

commit_message:
Merge tag '1.1.0' into debian/newton

  * New upstream release.
  * Fixed (build-)depends for this release.
  * Standards-Version is now 3.9.8 (no change).
  * Using OpenStack's Gerrit as VCS URLs.
  * debian/source/options: ignores egg-info and .gitreview.
  * Using pkgos-dh_auto_{test,install} from openstack-pkg-tools >= 52~.
  * Adding bandit, bandit-baseline and bandit-config-generator binary in
    debian/bin to have unit tests and config generation to work.
  * Generate the bandit.yaml using bandit-config-generator.
  * Do not run functional tests that are failing.
  * Do not attempt to install bandit.yaml (file gone upstream).

Change-Id: I8bb004137c19a63589a88e348c139d462afd28c8

subject: Port password generation from tripleoclient to tripleo-common
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-09 16:56:45.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-common/commit/377c1f5a3554a22cbe9034ef4a2ed984d669a14f', 'message': '[WIP] Port password generation from tripleoclient to tripleo-common

At the moment the CLI generates various passwords, this logic is
then not available to the GUI. We should move this to further
standardise the process.

This patch ports the necessary utility methods and adds an action
to generate and store passwords in a mistral environment or retrieve
previously generated passwords from the mistral environment.  The
passwords are stored in parameter_defaults and are used in any
subsequent calls to heat (e.g. Parameters and Stack Creation)

WIP Notes
 - needs tests
 - needs to be added to plan creation or deployment actions
 - ResetParametersAction will destroy these passwords
   - should they be destroyed?
   - add docs to explain what to do after parameters reset to ensure
     passwords exist for deployment
   - add constraint to ResetParametersAction to deny reset if stack
     is running?

Change-Id: Ic476a09f7981d4e6ee12e05b333a18cda5b4626b
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-09-14 15:35:52.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-common/commit/8ea30822a95f197a69fe605f8fd61e53b0b09f0f', 'message': 'Port password generation from tripleoclient to tripleo-common

At the moment the CLI generates various passwords, this logic is
then not available to the GUI. We should move this to further
standardise the process.

This patch ports the necessary utility methods and adds an action
to generate and store passwords in a mistral environment or retrieve
previously generated passwords from the mistral environment.  The
passwords are stored in parameter_defaults and are used in any
subsequent calls to heat (e.g. Parameters and Stack Creation).
The order of the merge of parameter_defaults and passwords allows
a user to override a password value.

The action is added to workflows in the plan_management workbook.

Closes-Bug: #1621097
Change-Id: Ic476a09f7981d4e6ee12e05b333a18cda5b4626b

commit_message:
Port password generation from tripleoclient to tripleo-common

At the moment the CLI generates various passwords, this logic is
then not available to the GUI. We should move this to further
standardise the process.

This patch ports the necessary utility methods and adds an action
to generate and store passwords in a mistral environment or retrieve
previously generated passwords from the mistral environment.  The action
will generate and replace any missing passwords.  The passwords are
stored in parameter_defaults and are used in any subsequent calls to heat
(e.g. Parameters and Stack Creation).

The order of the merge of parameter_defaults and passwords allows
a user to override a password value.

The action is added to workflows in the plan_management workbook.

Closes-Bug: #1621097
Change-Id: Ic476a09f7981d4e6ee12e05b333a18cda5b4626b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-common refs/changes/50/368150/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright 2016 Red Hat, Inc. # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import base64 import os import six import struct import time import passlib.utils as passutils from tripleo_common import exception _MIN_PASSWORD_SIZE = 25 _PASSWORD_NAMES = ( "OVERCLOUD_ADMIN_PASSWORD", "OVERCLOUD_ADMIN_TOKEN", "OVERCLOUD_AODH_PASSWORD", "OVERCLOUD_BARBICAN_PASSWORD", "OVERCLOUD_CEILOMETER_PASSWORD", "OVERCLOUD_CEILOMETER_SECRET", "OVERCLOUD_CINDER_PASSWORD", "OVERCLOUD_DEMO_PASSWORD", "OVERCLOUD_GLANCE_PASSWORD", "OVERCLOUD_GNOCCHI_PASSWORD", "OVERCLOUD_HAPROXY_STATS_PASSWORD", "OVERCLOUD_HEAT_PASSWORD", "OVERCLOUD_HEAT_STACK_DOMAIN_PASSWORD", "OVERCLOUD_IRONIC_PASSWORD", "OVERCLOUD_MANILA_PASSWORD", "OVERCLOUD_MISTRAL_PASSWORD", "OVERCLOUD_MYSQL_CLUSTERCHECK_PASSWORD", "OVERCLOUD_NEUTRON_PASSWORD", "OVERCLOUD_NOVA_PASSWORD", "OVERCLOUD_RABBITMQ_PASSWORD", "OVERCLOUD_REDIS_PASSWORD", "OVERCLOUD_SAHARA_PASSWORD", "OVERCLOUD_SWIFT_HASH", "OVERCLOUD_SWIFT_PASSWORD", "OVERCLOUD_TROVE_PASSWORD", "OVERCLOUD_ZAQAR_PASSWORD", "NEUTRON_METADATA_PROXY_SHARED_SECRET" ) _CEPH_PASSWORD_NAMES = ( "OVERCLOUD_CEPH_MON_KEY", "OVERCLOUD_CEPH_ADMIN_KEY", "OVERCLOUD_CEPH_CLIENT_KEY", "OVERCLOUD_CEPH_RGW_KEY" ) def generate_overcloud_passwords(): """Create the passwords needed for the overcloud This will create the set of passwords required by the overcloud, store them in the output file path and return a dictionary of passwords. If the file already exists the existing passwords will be returned instead, """ passwords = {} for name in _PASSWORD_NAMES: if not passwords.get(name): passwords[name] = passutils.generate_password( size=_MIN_PASSWORD_SIZE) # CephX keys aren't random strings for name in _CEPH_PASSWORD_NAMES: if not passwords.get(name): passwords[name] = create_cephx_key() return passwords def create_cephx_key(): # NOTE(gfidente): Taken from # https://github.com/ceph/ceph-deploy/blob/master/ceph_deploy/new.py#L21 key = os.urandom(16) header = struct.pack("<hiih", 1, int(time.time()), 0, len(key)) return base64.b64encode(header + key) def get_value_from_undercloud_passwords_file(section, option): p = six.moves.configparser.ConfigParser() password_filename = os.path.expanduser("~/undercloud-passwords.conf") if not os.path.exists(password_filename): raise exception.PasswordFileNotFound( "Undercloud password file (%s) not found" % password_filename) p.read(password_filename) return p.get(section, option)

commit_message:
Revert "Add is_authenticated and is_anonymous properties"

Reverting before release. See
http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/irclogs/%23openstack-release/%23openstack-release.2016-09-27.log.html#t2016-09-27T12:25:00
from 12:25 to 14:15.

This reverts commit 03a6db3074e605b901ba68d210bc58f3769a9560.

Change-Id: I4e50dc38f8b41d5730d8f613dd24d7384ca455e5

added_lines: def is_authenticated(self, margin=None): """Checks for a valid authentication. :param margin: A security time margin in seconds before end of authentication. Will return ``False`` if authentication ends in less than ``margin`` seconds of time. A default margin can be set by the TOKEN_TIMEOUT_MARGIN in the django settings. """ return (self.token is not None and utils.is_token_valid(self.token, margin)) def is_anonymous(self, margin=None): """Return if the user is not authenticated. Returns ``True`` if not authenticated,``False`` otherwise. :param margin: A security time margin in seconds before end of an eventual authentication. Will return ``True`` even if authenticated but that authentication ends in less than ``margin`` seconds of time. A default margin can be set by the TOKEN_TIMEOUT_MARGIN in the django settings. """ return not self.is_authenticated(margin)
deleted_lines: import djangofrom django.utils import deprecation if django.VERSION >= (1, 10): @property def is_authenticated(self): """Checks for a valid authentication.""" if (self.token is not None and utils.is_token_valid(self.token)): return deprecation.CallableTrue else: return deprecation.CallableFalse @property def is_anonymous(self): """Return if the user is not authenticated. Returns ``True`` if not authenticated,``False`` otherwise. """ return deprecation.CallableBool(not self.is_authenticated) else: def is_authenticated(self, margin=None): """Checks for a valid authentication. :param margin: A security time margin in seconds before end of authentication. Will return ``False`` if authentication ends in less than ``margin`` seconds of time. A default margin can be set by the TOKEN_TIMEOUT_MARGIN in the django settings. """ return (self.token is not None and utils.is_token_valid(self.token, margin)) def is_anonymous(self, margin=None): """Return if the user is not authenticated. Returns ``True`` if not authenticated,``False`` otherwise. :param margin: A security time margin in seconds before end of an eventual authentication. Will return ``True`` even if authenticated but that authentication ends in less than ``margin`` seconds of time. A default margin can be set by the TOKEN_TIMEOUT_MARGIN in the django settings. """ return not self.is_authenticated(margin)

commit_message:
VCS fix

  * Point .gitreview to OpenStack's Gerrit packaging-deb.
  * Using OpenStack's Gerrit as VCS URLs.
  * Add .gitreview to extend-diff-ignore.

Change-Id: Ic391c97a89d9680158e05ead06a5b4d59cf703ff

commit_message:
Puppet OpenStack Newton RC2

9.4.0 will be our RC2.

We will need to branch stable/newton for the following modules:
puppet-aodh
puppet-barbican
puppet-ceilometer
puppet-cinder
puppet-designate
puppet-glance
puppet-gnocchi
puppet-heat
puppet-horizon
puppet-ironic
puppet-keystone
puppet-magnum
puppet-manila
puppet-mistral
puppet-murano
puppet-neutron
puppet-nova
puppet-openstack_extras
puppet-openstacklib
puppet-oslo
puppet-ovn
puppet-sahara
puppet-swift
puppet-tempest
puppet-trove
puppet-vswitch
puppet-zaqar

It should be noted that we will not be branching a stable/newton for the
puppet-ceph module.

Change-Id: I68cb99c9c1964c3aa023ea6ab833a447e7e8c750

commit_message:
Increase timeout for pkg_upgrade task

In some slow envs this task can take more then 1800s, so
hence we need to increase timeout.

Change-Id: Icd23b1e95bed91d7312e19cc21010bac1a47f1b8
Closes-bug: #1623093

commit_message:
VCS fix

  * Point the .gitreview file to OpenStack's Gerrit packaging-deb.
  * Using OpenStack's Gerrit as VCS URLs.
  * d/s/options: extend-diff-ignore = "^[.]gitreview$"

Change-Id: Ia1048aa4a58adfac4c7599319e6b651640aa11b3

commit_message:
Update all SHAs for 14.0.0 2016-09-27

This patch updates all the roles to the latest available stable
SHA's, copies the release notes from the updated roles into the
integrated repo, updates all the OpenStack Service SHA's, and
updates the appropriate python requirements pins.

Change-Id: Ib7bf91e0cccc10ebd704ea2a61de83b2d5df0c53

commit_message:
Add the atop service UI settings section

This change adds the appropriate section to UI settings page.
It contains the default settings from the fuel-library and the
note message for an operator.

DocImpact
Change-Id: Ie0e69f58183193455d5d036b45668a3476f1a693
Partial-Bug: #1597250
Signed-off-by: Maksim Malchuk <mmalchuk@mirantis.com>
(cherry picked from commit dee15ae89ea65320d45326301de299d7526e6d9d)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-web refs/changes/57/338157/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: atop: metadata: label: "Advanced System & Process Monitor (atop)" weight: 60 group: "logging" toggleable: false enabled: true service_enabled: value: true label: "Enable atop service" description: | NOTE: When enabled, the service may generate logs up to a gigabyte in size per day. This should be taken into consideration when determining the correct size for the log partition. weight: 10 type: "checkbox" interval: description: "Interval between the snapshots in seconds" value: "20" label: "Interval between the snapshots" weight: 20 type: "text" regex: source: '^[1-9]\d*$' error: "Should be a number of seconds" restrictions: - condition: "settings:atop.service_enabled.value == false" action: "hide" rotate: description: "Number of days to keep log files" value: "7" label: "Rotate days" weight: 30 type: "text" regex: source: '^[1-9]\d*$' error: "Should be a number of days" restrictions: - condition: "settings:atop.service_enabled.value == false" action: "hide"

commit_message:
Addition of metadata for snapshot in VolumeSnapshot object

When accessing the snapshot object in Horizon codebase, we do not have
access to the metadata of the snapshot. This is because the
VolumeSnapshot object does not have metadata as a member. So added
'metadata' to the VolumeSnapshot object. The fix should provide access
to metadata.
Added test data and test cases for snapshot object with metadata.

Closes-Bug: 1542468

Change-Id: I4ae2e7a74d3ddbff8493b42f8f86c7002229cf8c

commit_message:
Always pass info to external DNS

The current logic prior to this patch would _only_ set pass info to
external DNS under the following circumstances:

* The network is a flat non-provider network
* The network has 2 or more subnets

These are strange requirements to say the least, but I see no reason
not to be setting DNS for every instance spawn, regardless of network
type.

Change-Id: I6204a6a5b513b4b8b00ca457c1bdcb8db1fc4b97
Closes-Bug: 1616274

commit_message:
Add atop configuration settings

Now the atop setting are configurable from UI and can be overriden in
hiera. Also, this change adds idempotency and fix noop tests.

DocImpact

commit_message:
Fix metadata removal

This fixes the case where known metadata types were not being removed
upon saving.  When trying to apply name changes to the provided value,
the work was done out of order, causing the item to be taken out
of the 'removed' list.

Change-Id: I0058ce369a9616b4c49f3d6d1a54cf69144e2f0c
Co-Authored-By: Matt Wood <matt.wood@hpe.com>
Closes-Bug: 1618578
(cherry picked from commit 2425e6e860932514c963844dfab6d24b023883bf)

commit_message:
Add quotes to versions

If developer try to specify verions using `>=` without quotes,
yaml loader exception will be raised during uploding package
to murano.

Closes-Bug: #1627983
Change-Id: I42fad7ae6c4e2aff191ca165a364facbeb027845

commit_message:
[docs] Add info about template() contract

Change-Id: Iad233cba1cadff12267292f70898d704e687d495
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/murano refs/changes/90/374590/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: | | $.template(ns:ClassName) | | value must be a dictionary with object-model representation of specified class name | | | $.template(ns:ClassName).notNull() | | +-----------------------------------------------------------+-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+In the example below property ``port`` must be int value greater than 0 andThe ``template`` contract does the same validation as the ``class`` contract, but does not require the actual object to be passed as a property or argument. Instead it allows to create an object from the given template later. Also there is a capability to exclude some of the properties from validation and provide them later in the body of the method. Consider the following example: .. code-block:: yaml Namespaces: =: io.murano.applications res: io.murano.resources std: io.murano Name: TemplateServerProvider Extends: ReplicaProvider Properties: template: Contract: $.template(res:Instance, excludeProperties => [name]).notNull() serverNamePattern: Contract: $.string().notNull() allocated: Usage: Out Contract: $.int().notNull() Default: 0 capacity: Contract: $.int() Methods: createReplica: Arguments: - index: Contract: $.int().notNull() - owner: Contract: $.class(std:Object) Body: - If: $this.capacity = null or $this.allocated < $this.capacity Then: - $template: $this.template - $template.name: $this.serverNamePattern.format($index) - $ownerGroup: $this.find(ServerGroup) - If: $ownerGroup and name($ownerGroup) Then: - $groupName: format(' ({0})', name($ownerGroup)) Else: - $groupName: '' - $template['?'].name: format('Server {0}{1}', $index, $groupName) - $this.allocated: $this.allocated + 1 - Return: new($template, $owner) Else: - Return: null In the example above the class has the ``template`` property that is validated by the ``template`` contract. It holds the template of the object of the ``Instance`` class or its inheritor. In the ``createReplica`` method ``template`` is used to dynamically create instances in runtime considering some conditions and customizing the ``name`` property of an instance, as it was excluded from validation. It is still possible to pass an actual object to the property or argument with ``template`` contract, but it will be automatically converted to its object model representation.

This use case isn't covered by our current APIs:

  GET /entities?id={entity_id}
  GET /entities?entity_id={entity_id}

Because we have a dedicated API for that:

  GET /entities/{entity_id}

But our find() methods generally support **kwargs, which are passed as
query parameters to keystone. When an 'id' or 'entity_id' is passed to
keystone as a query parameter, keystone rightly ignores it and returns
an unfiltered collection.

This change raises a client-side TypeError (as you'd expect when you try
to pass a keyword argument that a function isn't expecting), and
includes a helpful suggestion to try calling get() instead.

commit_message:
Prevent attempts to "filter" find() calls by globally unique IDs

This use case isn't covered by our current APIs:

  GET /entities?id={entity_id}
  GET /entities?entity_id={entity_id}

Because we have a dedicated API for that:

  GET /entities/{entity_id}

But our find() methods generally support **kwargs, which are passed as
query parameters to keystone. When an 'id' or 'entity_id' is passed to
keystone as a query parameter, keystone rightly ignores it and returns
an unfiltered collection.

This change raises a client-side TypeError (as you'd expect when you try
to pass a keyword argument that a function isn't expecting), and
includes a helpful suggestion to try calling get() instead.

Change-Id: Ieb44b3ada360a2691b95528c80780249a3906627
Closes-Bug: #1626640
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-keystoneclient refs/changes/11/377811/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from keystoneclient.exceptions import MethodNotImplemented def test_find_by_id(self, ref=None, **filter_kwargs): """Test ``entities.find(id=x)`` being rewritten as ``GET /v3/entities/x``. This tests an edge case of each manager's find() implementation, to ensure that it "does the right thing" when users call ``.find()`` when they should have used ``.get()``. """ if 'id' not in filter_kwargs: ref = ref or self.new_ref() filter_kwargs['id'] = ref['id'] try: self.assertRaises(TypeError, self.manager.find, **filter_kwargs) # RoleAssignmentManager do not supports Find method except MethodNotImplemented: pass except Exception: raise def test_find_by_entity_id(self, ref=None, **filter_kwargs): """Test ``entities.find(entity_id=x)``. This tests an edge case of each manager's find() implementation, to ensure that it "does the right thing" when users call ``.find()`` when they should have used ``.get()``. """ key = '{}_id'.format(self.key) if key not in filter_kwargs: filter_kwargs[key] = uuid.uuid4().hex try: self.assertRaises(TypeError, self.manager.find, **filter_kwargs) # RoleAssignmentManager do not supports Find method except MethodNotImplemented: pass except Exception: raise

commit_message:
Add Apache 2.0 license to source file

As per OpenStack licensing guide lines [1]:
[H102 H103] Newly contributed Source Code should be licensed under
the Apache 2.0 license.
[H104] Files with no code shouldnt contain any license header nor
comments, and must be left completely empty.

[1] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/hacking/#openstack-licensing

Change-Id: If6676d7bf7409ebec2a035bdae158b644e19a861

Reload only components tab of environment page

Previously during the deployment of env  without services all tabs
of env were reloading. Now only components page reloads.

added_lines: .. deployment-group: .. index:: deploy, group, Fuel, MOS, MOM, MCP Deployment group ---------------- A low-level grouping entity which works as an association between roles and deployment tasks. Fuel associates each group simultaneously with a role and a set of tasks. One role may be associated with more than one deployment group and one deployment group may be associated with several deployment tasks.

subject: Fix for vtep port
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-23 14:39:33.000000000', 'files': ['networking_ovn/tests/unit/test_ovn_vtep.py', 'networking_ovn/common/constants.py', 'networking_ovn/tests/unit/ml2/test_mech_driver.py', 'networking_ovn/ml2/mech_driver.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/networking-ovn/commit/16ab14c9c527e413cc57248d1c521321b07ca796', 'message': 'Fix for vtep port Ovn Nb database requires vtep port options to be specified as follows. The code sets the vtep keys wrongly. As a result, vtep-gw cannot bind to the vtep port. The port binding profile keys are also changed to be consistent with OVN NB vtep keys.

These options apply when is vtep.

Required. The name of the VTEP gateway. Required. A logical switch name connected by the VTEP gateway. Closes-Bug: 1624161 Change-Id: Iff51c5b2edaf0b2e5c80fafe012ec6feb495f7f3 (cherry picked from commit 275475fc9ff8539d952ec1e3bc0e2aa61b262c74) '}]
commit_message:
Fix for vtep port Ovn Nb database requires vtep port options to be specified as follows. The code sets the vtep keys wrongly. As a result, vtep-gw cannot bind to the vtep port. The port binding profile keys are also changed to be consistent with OVN NB vtep keys.

These options apply when is vtep.

Required. The name of the VTEP gateway. Required. A logical switch name connected by the VTEP gateway. Closes-Bug: 1624161 Change-Id: Iff51c5b2edaf0b2e5c80fafe012ec6feb495f7f3 (cherry picked from commit 275475fc9ff8539d952ec1e3bc0e2aa61b262c74)

commit_message:
Allow 200 as a response from /v2/zone/recordsets

Designate can return a 200 or a 202, depending on the status
of an API call.

This allows tempest to accept the 200

Change-Id: I0e9c38bb8f11f7c9ee31d4f7eb710b7df30674df

commit_message:
Reset rabbitmq default for net_ticktime to 60 sec

This parameter should be increased to eliminate the triggering partition
handling logic on spurious network partitions/outages.

Closes-Bug: #1598154
Change-Id: I1759ee27ddeae9334d7d9653d87127a914b79a37
(backported 7f7214abf3e174e9ef84dc86fae2f5b2ca4a237d)

commit_message:
Devstack to support CONGRESS_REPLICATED flag

This commit starts multiple PE's if replicated flag is enabled.
Added a non-voting gate job to run the existing tempest tests
with multiple PE's https://review.openstack.org/#/c/365862/

Depends-On: Iab1b7e0e6502c8f152f8c136e34d41ac8cdbd79f
Change-Id: Ieac1fda09f7324fb03de6002614b2092d8ff9722
(cherry picked from commit 178cef7334cc9bbe4b921e47417bf28b939b4afe)

commit_message:
RBAC for network sharing

Adds support for the new Newton Neutron RBAC
policy functionality. This allows networks to be
shared across tenants.

For more information, please take a look at:
https://developer.rackspace.com/blog/A-First-Look-at-RBAC-in-the-Liberty-Release-of-Neutron/

Change-Id: Ie433dbd2554648bad7ca9f6940069c85258b03c7
Implements: blueprint neutron-tenant-rbac

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-26 18:36:24.000000000', 'files': ['networking_bagpipe/tests/unit/agent/test_bagpipe_bgp_agent.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/networking-bagpipe/commit/1e523da49fce9a66644841c4a2cacd39a09890b1', 'message': 'Modify use of assertTrue(A in B)

commit_message:
Modify use of assertTrue(A in B)

Use assertIn(A, B) instead of assertTrue(A in B)

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I341cac74869bf17bfe4d7ef5688891145abda46b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-bagpipe refs/changes/11/377011/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self.assertNotIn(network_id, self.agent.reg_attachments, "Network %s expected to have no attachments left" % network_id) else: self.assertIn(network_id, self.agent.reg_attachments) self.assertIn(notifier, attachment, "No %s details found in attachment %s" % (notifier, attachment)) for vpn_type in vpn_types: self.assertIn(vpn_type, attachment[notifier], "No %s %s details found in " "attachment %s" % (notifier, vpn_type, attachment))
deleted_lines: self.assertTrue(network_id not in self.agent.reg_attachments, "Network %s expected to have no attachments left" % network_id) else: self.assertTrue(network_id in self.agent.reg_attachments) self.assertTrue(notifier in attachment, "No %s details found in attachment %s" % (notifier, attachment)) for vpn_type in vpn_types: self.assertTrue(vpn_type in attachment[notifier], "No %s %s details found in " "attachment %s" % (notifier, vpn_type, attachment))

subject: Add X-Frame-Options header to Nginx
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-15 14:55:30.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/puppet/nailgun/templates/nginx.conf.erb'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library/commit/ea6106dd35af1a2d2427cef53aa8c4561f0ac38d', 'message': "Add X-Frame-Options header to Nginx

This commit adds the 'X-Frame-Options: SAMEORIGIN' header by default
to all HTTP responses to instruct the modern browsers to prevent from
clickjacking attacks.

Change-Id: I6fb9fa81c454cf93e3c386026588b345da760c73
Closes-Bug: #1592794
Signed-off-by: Maksim Malchuk <mmalchuk@mirantis.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Add X-Frame-Options header to Nginx

This commit adds the 'X-Frame-Options: SAMEORIGIN' header by default
to all HTTP responses to instruct the modern browsers to prevent from
clickjacking attacks.

Change-Id: I6fb9fa81c454cf93e3c386026588b345da760c73
Closes-Bug: #1592794
Signed-off-by: Maksim Malchuk <mmalchuk@mirantis.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library refs/changes/93/329993/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #prevent from clickjacking attacks add_header X-Frame-Options SAMEORIGIN;

subject: Hardcode part_power for swift ring builder
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-30 11:26:28.000000000', 'files': ['tests/noop/spec/hosts/swift/swift_spec.rb', 'deployment/puppet/osnailyfacter/modular/swift/swift.pp'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library/commit/ca8415f11b20610a0c02829c9217f1c41ef07099', 'message': "Hardcode part_power for swift ring builder

The default part_power for 3 controllers should
be 10. Previous deployments calculated the part_power
of 3 controllers to 10, so this should be preserved
for future deployments.

For custom deployments which require a different part_power,
it should be set in swift_hash in the key 'ring_part_power'.

DocImpact: Should advise users before upgrading from a prior
release about swift ring part_power.
Change-Id: Ic7f8f6824712cc2bb5b530fe1300c9a3ac4ce302
Closes-Bug: #1498368
(cherry picked from commit 22e51270d56a650fdb3b76549e07cf93be31bb4b)
"}]
commit_message:
Hardcode part_power for swift ring builder

The default part_power for 3 controllers should
be 10. Previous deployments calculated the part_power
of 3 controllers to 10, so this should be preserved
for future deployments.

For custom deployments which require a different part_power,
it should be set in swift_hash in the key 'ring_part_power'.

DocImpact: Should advise users before upgrading from a prior
release about swift ring part_power.
Change-Id: Ic7f8f6824712cc2bb5b530fe1300c9a3ac4ce302
Closes-Bug: #1498368
(cherry picked from commit 22e51270d56a650fdb3b76549e07cf93be31bb4b)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library refs/changes/08/299308/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # NOTE(mattymo): Changing ring_part_power or part_hours on redeploy leads to data loss $ring_part_power = pick($swift_hash['ring_part_power'], 10)

commit_message:
tox: shorter envdir name for upgrade target

The shebang of a script in linux is limited to 127 chars (execve
limitation). In gate, within the virtualenv the python path in all
binaries shebang is a bit long:

/home/jenkins/workspace/gate-gnocchi-tox-db-py35-postgresql-file-upgrade-from-2.2-ubuntu-xenial/.tox/py35-postgresql-file-upgrade-from-2.2/bin/python

This change sets a envdir manually to workaround the issue and keep
explicit name in tox target.

Change-Id: I6edadc5e03891595db23afc12ee36a519989bd8a

commit_message:
Add the atop service UI settings section

This change adds the appropriate section to UI settings page.
It contains the default settings from the fuel-library and the
note message for an operator.

DocImpact
Change-Id: Ie0e69f58183193455d5d036b45668a3476f1a693
Partial-Bug: #1597250
Signed-off-by: Maksim Malchuk <mmalchuk@mirantis.com>
(cherry picked from commit dee15ae89ea65320d45326301de299d7526e6d9d)

commit_message:
Metadata definition namespaces Negative Test cases

Following Negative test cases added

1. show non-existent metadata definition namespace
2. update non-existent metadata definition namespace
3. delete non-existent metadata definition namespace

Change-Id: Ib78fe01d0905af5a431b8a39f7b1e94e42787ee8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/36/239436/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright 2015 GlobalLogic. All rights reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from tempest.api.image import base from tempest.common.utils import data_utils from tempest import test from tempest_lib import exceptions as lib_exc class MetadataiNamespacesNegativeTest(base.BaseV2ImageTest): """here we have negative tests for Tests ** show non-existent metadef namespace ** update non-existent metadef namespace ** delete non-existent metadef namespace """ @test.attr(type=['negative']) @test.idempotent_id('319b765e-7f3d-4b3d-8b37-3ca3876ff781') def test_get_update_delete_non_existent_meta_definition_namespaces(self): namespace_name = data_utils.rand_name('namespace') # get non-existent metadata definition namespaces self.assertRaises(lib_exc.NotFound, self.client.show_namespaces, namespace_name) # update non-existent metadata definition namespaces self.assertRaises(lib_exc.NotFound, self.client.update_namespaces, namespace=namespace_name, description='Tempest', visibility='private', display_name=namespace_name, protected=False) # delete non-existent metadata definition namespaces self.assertRaises(lib_exc.NotFound, self.client.delete_namespaces, namespace_name)

commit_message:
Use a shared lock directory for Nova and Cinder

When running nova and cinder on the same node they require
synchronization for locks in os-brick. To support this
os-brick uses named locks, but it requires the two to use
the same directories for their locks.

Change-Id: Ic76b90be08bf03a9dfa3d3916fba4603594cac8f

commit_message:
Filter data when deserializing RevokeEvents

The RevokeEvent loads in with **data meaning that the data is
passed to the RevokeEvent.__init__ method without any sanitization.

We now filter and report explicitly where we had the issue. If the
key is not relevant to the RevokeEvent it is ignored (and logged
via debug).

This bug should be effectively resolved but maintained open for
tracking purposes until we are comfortable in simply closing it
out.

Change-Id: Ife604ae30224581760042932b8561ab7961e993b
Partial-Bug: #1609566

added_lines: import sixfrom keystone.i18n import _LE filtered_data = {} try: for key, value in revoke_event_data.values(): # NOTE(notmorgan): This loop is designed to ensure we # do not somehow deserialize the RevokeEvent in a bizzare # way resulting in the wrong kind(s) of data. It explicitly # drops the data that is not a valid keyword-type when # instantiating the RevokeEvent on the floor and logs it. # This absolutely *should* be a bug. This also eliminates # any keys that would not be actually used to instantiate # the RevokeEvent. if isinstance(key, (str, bytes)): if key not in REVOKE_KEYS: LOG.debug('Unknown key `%r` found in deserialized data' ' `%r`', key, revoke_event_data) continue if isinstance(key, six.binary_type): key = key.decode('utf-8') filtered_data[key] = value else: # NOTE(notmorgan): It is possible we should error # here, however for sanity because the revoke event is # unlikely to match anyway, we are not erroring out. LOG.error(_LE('Received non-string key value when ' 'deserializing RevokeEvent. This is a bug ' 'and should be reported relatred to bug ' '#1609566 with: invalid key `%{key}r` ' 'deserialized data: `%{data}r`'), key, revoke_event_data) continue revoke_event = RevokeEvent(**filtered_data) except Exception: LOG.debug("Failed to deserialize RevokeEvent. Data is %r",

commit_message:
Refetch subnet/network from DB in ML2 update ops

This ensures that any extensions run in the ML2 extension framework
that bump the revision number of the subnet or network result in the
altered revision number being returned to the API caller and passed
into the ML2 mech drivers and callback handlers.

Closes-Bug: #1627628
Change-Id: Ieb37a3833ee52c671419c6dc981cf91c2366ae94

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-22 01:17:22.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/extensions/extra_dhcp_opt.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/agent/linux/test_dhcp.py', 'neutron/agent/linux/dhcp.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/96f2d838ae1f295cb565dbd1e98649d2138ec81f', 'message': 'Unable to add classless-static-route in extra_dhcp_opt extension

When adding classless-static-route in extra_dhcp_opt for a port,
neutron client complains syntax error. The reason is neutron client
interprets the "," inside the opt_value as a delimiter of key-value
pairs for --extra-dhcp-opt.

This patch allows users to use spaces in the opt_value.
Then convert spaces to commas when writing them to opts file.

Closes-Bug: #1605421
Change-Id: I5bc3446d47ff417143038a437c7e7a5c8fe140c4
'}]
commit_message:
Unable to add classless-static-route in extra_dhcp_opt extension

When adding classless-static-route in extra_dhcp_opt for a port,
neutron client complains syntax error. The reason is neutron client
interprets the "," inside the opt_value as a delimiter of key-value
pairs for --extra-dhcp-opt.

This patch allows users to use spaces in the opt_value.
Then convert spaces to commas when writing them to opts file.

This is one of two proposed solutions described in #1605421.

Closes-Bug: #1605421
Change-Id: I5bc3446d47ff417143038a437c7e7a5c8fe140c4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/20/345720/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Add Ironic vars and play to central test repo

Ironic requires some new glance vars, as well as the ironic vars.

This ensures facts are set for the ironic host, as well as adding the
test-install-ironic.yml play so it can benefit from the common tasks
more easily.

Change-Id: Ib5dee3ee50a4a1a443ebf7b744001d6f5bd40d1e

commit_message:
standardize release note page ordering

In order to support automatically updating the release notes when we
create stable branches, we want the pages to be in a standard order.
This patch updates the order to be reverse chronological, so the most
recent notes appear at the top.

Change-Id: I8d7bc165dd1c623498397ac9259f767b3d371172

commit_message:
Modify the general API for the database backend

Currently database connection is ahead of loading opts
from config file, which leading to config opts can't
take effect on database selection.

Closes-bug: #1627568

Change-Id: Ibbc20231c146216961d329503c245f2d4cd534b4
Signed-off-by: Kevin Zhao <kevin.zhao@linaro.org>

added_lines: openstack-pkg-tools lsb-release gnupg haveged # Jessie needs lintian from jessie-backports, because we are using # newer debhelper. New lintian prevents errors like # postinst-must-call-ldconfig if [ "${HOST_DISTRO_NAME}" = "jessie" ] ; then add_bpo_repo_to_host # Use lintian from backports DEBIAN_FRONTEND=noninteractive sudo apt-get install -y --no-install-recommends -t jessie-backports lintian # This code thinks anything else than jessie is higher version of lintian else DEBIAN_FRONTEND=noninteractive sudo apt-get install -y --no-install-recommends lintian fi

commit_message:
Delete all necessary delayed calls on WF stop

Change-Id: I50d8164aa022a80e255ca4610ef0393ff802663e
Partial-Bug: #1627443
(cherry picked from commit 2f817e9b70877dadc3523b8d79fc74766364f152)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/mistral refs/changes/48/377348/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def delete_join_completion_check_on_stop(self): wf_text = """--- version: '2.0' wf: tasks: task1: action: std.noop on-success: join_task task2: description: Never ends action: std.async_noop on-success: join_task join_task: join: all """ wf_service.create_workflows(wf_text) wf_ex = self.engine.start_workflow('wf', {}) tasks = db_api.get_task_executions(workflow_execution_id=wf_ex.id) self.assertTrue(len(tasks) >= 2) task1 = self._assert_single_item(tasks, name='task1') self.await_task_success(task1.id) # Once task1 is finished we know that join_task must be created. tasks = db_api.get_task_executions(workflow_execution_id=wf_ex.id) self._assert_single_item( tasks, name='join_task', state=states.WAITING ) calls = db_api.get_delayed_calls() mtd_name = 'mistral.engine.task_handler._refresh_task_state' self._assert_single_item(calls, target_method_name=mtd_name) # Stop the workflow. self.engine.stop_workflow(wf_ex.id, state=states.CANCELLED) self._await( lambda: len(db_api.get_delayed_calls(target_method_name=mtd_name)) == 0 )

commit_message:
Remove default=None when set value in Config

By default oslo.cfg sets the default values as None [1], There is no need
to explicitly do this.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/oslo.config/blob/master/oslo_config/cfg.py#L829

Change-Id: I072f88b8c5277cffa155c1b517cf9a4411dadc41

commit_message:
Misc fixes

This PS fixes some formatting issues with minikube.rst. Changes a
few defaults to make things more consistent and orders the nodeport
config options together. Adds a way to expose the rabbitmq
management service externally if desired. It fixes setting the
external ip address for all in one setups that need an ip set.

Change-Id: I7756ebe6509a2e5c4c475ce7076bd56ffd7ef5ef

commit_message:
lib/neutron: Rename core plugin variables

NEUTRON_PLUGIN -> NEUTRON_CORE_PLUGIN
NEUTRON_PLUGIN_* -> NEUTRON_CORE_PLUGIN_*

Change-Id: I1d93d8bd1e6e3bbca0e56a2da0684ab3f3fbb525
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/20/359620/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: NEUTRON_CORE_PLUGIN=${NEUTRON_CORE_PLUGIN:-ml2} NEUTRON_CORE_PLUGIN_CONF_FILENAME=${NEUTRON_CORE_PLUGIN_CONF_FILENAME:-ml2_conf.ini} NEUTRON_CORE_PLUGIN_CONF_PATH=$NEUTRON_CONF_DIR/plugins/$NEUTRON_CORE_PLUGIN NEUTRON_CORE_PLUGIN_CONF=$NEUTRON_CORE_PLUGIN_CONF_PATH/$NEUTRON_CORE_PLUGIN_CONF_FILENAME mkdir -p $NEUTRON_CORE_PLUGIN_CONF_PATH cp $NEUTRON_DIR/etc/neutron/plugins/$NEUTRON_CORE_PLUGIN/$NEUTRON_CORE_PLUGIN_CONF_FILENAME.sample $NEUTRON_CORE_PLUGIN_CONF iniset $NEUTRON_CONF DEFAULT core_plugin $NEUTRON_CORE_PLUGIN iniset $NEUTRON_CORE_PLUGIN_CONF ml2 tenant_network_types ${NEUTRON_ML2_TENANT_NETWORK_TYPES} iniset $NEUTRON_CORE_PLUGIN_CONF ml2 type_drivers ${NEUTRON_ML2_TYPE_DRIVERS} iniset $NEUTRON_CORE_PLUGIN_CONF ml2 mechanism_drivers ${NEUTRON_ML2_MECHANISM_DRIVERS} iniset $NEUTRON_CORE_PLUGIN_CONF ml2_type_vxlan vni_ranges 1001:2000 iniset $NEUTRON_CORE_PLUGIN_CONF ml2 extension_drivers port_security iniset $NEUTRON_CORE_PLUGIN_CONF agent tunnel_types vxlan iniset $NEUTRON_CORE_PLUGIN_CONF DEFAULT debug True iniset $NEUTRON_CORE_PLUGIN_CONF securitygroup iptables iniset $NEUTRON_CORE_PLUGIN_CONF vxlan local_ip $HOST_IP iniset $NEUTRON_CORE_PLUGIN_CONF securitygroup iptables_hybrid iniset $NEUTRON_CORE_PLUGIN_CONF ovs local_ip $HOST_IP run_process neutron-api "$NEUTRON_BIN_DIR/neutron-server --config-file $NEUTRON_CONF --config-file $NEUTRON_CORE_PLUGIN_CONF" #TODO(sc68cal) OVS and LB agent uses settings in NEUTRON_CORE_PLUGIN_CONF (ml2_conf.ini) but others may not NEUTRON_CONFIG_ARG+=" --config-file $NEUTRON_CORE_PLUGIN_CONF"
deleted_lines: NEUTRON_PLUGIN=${NEUTRON_PLUGIN:-ml2} NEUTRON_PLUGIN_CONF_FILENAME=${NEUTRON_PLUGIN_CONF_FILENAME:-ml2_conf.ini} NEUTRON_PLUGIN_CONF_PATH=$NEUTRON_CONF_DIR/plugins/$NEUTRON_PLUGIN NEUTRON_PLUGIN_CONF=$NEUTRON_PLUGIN_CONF_PATH/$NEUTRON_PLUGIN_CONF_FILENAME mkdir -p $NEUTRON_PLUGIN_CONF_PATH cp $NEUTRON_DIR/etc/neutron/plugins/$NEUTRON_PLUGIN/$NEUTRON_PLUGIN_CONF_FILENAME.sample $NEUTRON_PLUGIN_CONF iniset $NEUTRON_CONF DEFAULT core_plugin $NEUTRON_PLUGIN iniset $NEUTRON_PLUGIN_CONF ml2 tenant_network_types ${NEUTRON_ML2_TENANT_NETWORK_TYPES} iniset $NEUTRON_PLUGIN_CONF ml2 type_drivers ${NEUTRON_ML2_TYPE_DRIVERS} iniset $NEUTRON_PLUGIN_CONF ml2 mechanism_drivers ${NEUTRON_ML2_MECHANISM_DRIVERS} iniset $NEUTRON_PLUGIN_CONF ml2_type_vxlan vni_ranges 1001:2000 iniset $NEUTRON_PLUGIN_CONF ml2 extension_drivers port_security iniset $NEUTRON_PLUGIN_CONF agent tunnel_types vxlan iniset $NEUTRON_PLUGIN_CONF DEFAULT debug True iniset $NEUTRON_PLUGIN_CONF securitygroup iptables iniset $NEUTRON_PLUGIN_CONF vxlan local_ip $HOST_IP iniset $NEUTRON_PLUGIN_CONF securitygroup iptables_hybrid iniset $NEUTRON_PLUGIN_CONF ovs local_ip $HOST_IP run_process neutron-api "$NEUTRON_BIN_DIR/neutron-server --config-file $NEUTRON_CONF --config-file $NEUTRON_PLUGIN_CONF" #TODO(sc68cal) OVS and LB agent uses settings in NEUTRON_PLUGIN_CONF (ml2_conf.ini) but others may not NEUTRON_CONFIG_ARG+=" --config-file $NEUTRON_PLUGIN_CONF"

subject: Use centos-release-ceph-jewel package
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-13 04:08:09.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/repositories.txt'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-docs/commit/864ff5f6b11309973e06a6d9ceea678fb7f3d5a9', 'message': "Use centos-release-ceph-jewel package

Previously we had to download from github the testing .repo file
to enable the testing repo for Ceph/Jewel. Now the Ceph packages
moved out of the testing phase and we can install the 'release'
package.

Change-Id: I24460a00e516a289b1fe5f8948f586ebe3de2505
Depends-On: I14003a8f00a4f07bcddafe6dc5928126f22362bd
"}]
commit_message:
Use centos-release-ceph-jewel package

Previously we had to download from github the testing .repo file
to enable the testing repo for Ceph/Jewel. Now the Ceph packages
moved out of the testing phase and we can install the 'release'
package.

Change-Id: I24460a00e516a289b1fe5f8948f586ebe3de2505
Depends-On: I14003a8f00a4f07bcddafe6dc5928126f22362bd
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-docs refs/changes/39/369139/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: sudo yum-config-manager --add-repo https://raw.githubusercontent.com/CentOS-Storage-SIG/centos-release-ceph-jewel/master/CentOS-Ceph-Jewel.repo sudo yum-config-manager --disable centos-ceph-jewel sudo yum-config-manager --enable centos-ceph-jewel-test

added_lines: def _get_reality(self): server = self.client().servers.get(self.resource_id) server_data = server.to_dict() server_reality = {self.FLAVOR: server_data[self.FLAVOR]['id']} if self.properties[self.IMAGE]: server_reality.update({self.IMAGE: server_data[self.IMAGE]['id']}) if server_data["OS-EXT-AZ:availability_zone"]: server_reality.update( {self.AVAILABILITY_ZONE: server_data[ "OS-EXT-AZ:availability_zone"]}) if server_data[self.SECURITY_GROUPS]: server_reality.update( {self.SECURITY_GROUPS: [group['name'] for group in server_data[ self.SECURITY_GROUPS]]}) if server_data['OS-EXT-SRV-ATTR:reservation_id']: server_reality.update( {self.RESERVATION_ID: server_data[ "OS-EXT-SRV-ATTR:reservation_id"]}) if server_data["OS-DCF:diskConfig"]: server_reality.update( {self.DISK_CONFIG: server_data["OS-DCF:diskConfig"]}) real_properties_keys = [self.NAME, self.KEY_NAME, self.METADATA, self.CONFIG_DRIVE] for key in real_properties_keys: if server_data[key]: server_reality.update({key: server_data[key]}) # Properties that doesn't changes in server or there is no way to get # them. inner_properties_keys = [self.FLAVOR_UPDATE_POLICY, self.IMAGE_UPDATE_POLICY, self.PERSONALITY, self.USER_DATA_FORMAT, self.USER_DATA, self.SCHEDULER_HINTS, self.SOFTWARE_CONFIG_TRANSPORT] for key in inner_properties_keys: if key in self.properties: server_reality.update({key: self.properties[key]}) # Because of encrypting password in nova and using change_password # to set new password, there's no need to parse password from server, # so we can use admin_pass from properties. server_reality.update( {self.ADMIN_PASS: self.properties[self.ADMIN_PASS]}) server_reality.update( {self.NETWORKS: self._get_networks_from_reality(server)}) # TODO(prazumovsky): add reality state parsing for bdm and bdm_v2 return server_reality def _get_networks_from_reality(self, server): reality_nets = self._add_port_for_address(server) resource_nets = self.properties[self.NETWORKS] result_nets = [] for net in resource_nets: net_id = self._get_network_id(net) if net_id in reality_nets: for address in reality_nets[net_id]: if (address["OS-EXT-IPS:type"] == 'fixed' and address['addr'] == net[self.NETWORK_FIXED_IP]): result_nets.append(net) return result_nets
